refsect1.title: SOAP
refsect1.para:
The SOAP version 1.1 is used in all interactions.
http://www.w3.org/TR/2000/NOTE-SOAP-20000508/

refsect1.title: WSDL
refsect1.para:
The WSDL version 1.0 is used to describe processes and partner services.
http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl

refsect1.title: WS-Addressing
refsect1.para:
The WS-Addressing is used to correlate asyncronous messages (as in Loan Flow example). Also it is used to determine the reply endpoint URL when process is called by asyncronus way.
WS-Addressing Specification

refsect1.title: WS-Security
refsect1.para: The WS-Security is used in the example to encrypt and sign the data when calling the partner services. Also it's used in secure variant of the echo to make a secure reply to the caller.

The required version is OASIS WS-Security specification.
http://www.oasis-open.org/specs/index.php#wssv1.0
The messages are signed using X.509 binary token and encrypted with an AES 128 session key. The asymetric RSA keys are used to make the signature and session key encryption.
The certificates containing the RSA keys are same as example certificates in Microsoft(R) WSE 2.0 toolkit. Where 'server' certificate is used in partners and 'client' is used as process' certificate.

View certificates:
ServerPrivate
ClientPrivate
ServerPublic with public key only
ClientPublic with public key only

refsect1.title: WS-ReliableMessaging
refsect1.para: The asyncronous operations with partners are invoked via WS-RM protocol with policy 'Exacly Once'.

The required version is OASIS WS-RM protocol.
http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/dnglobspec/html/WS-RM-exec-summary.asp
